remarks: Two distinct lines intersect in at most one point.  Theorem 6.21 of [Schwabhauser] p. 46.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-May-2019.)
statement:
tglineintmo.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineintmo.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglineintmo.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ran L ) $.
tglineintmo.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ran L ) $.
tglineintmo.c $e |- ( ph -> A =/= B ) $.
tglineintmo $p |- ( ph -> E* x ( x e. A /\ x e. B ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d ph x $.
